DataElement.preferredName: Radionuclide Imaging Agent Administration Start Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date the radionuclide imaging agent was administered represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Radionuclide Imaging Agent Administration Start Date
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent._The calendar date on which something is to start or did start.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.:The calendar date on which something is to start or did start.

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2006399 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
